comment._content: this is one of the better shots of luna park i've encountered...

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: @Luna Park - we've got a ton of images like this in our collection - all old glass negatives.  We are just starting a project now to scan and catalog many of them in the hopes that we can add them to the Flickr Commons.  It's a really big project, so you probably won't see them until early summer :)  ~shelley

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image is part of the Indicommons.org tribute to New York City on its *400th* anniversary.

comment.author: 43009124@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called LUNA PARK 2010 CONEY ISLAND BROOKLYN, NY, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 43009124@N07
comment._content: The Mardi Gras banner makes it seem timeless like last year, not 1912!

comment.author: 60899404@N07
comment._content: Zamperela ought to have taken a real close look at how incredible the buildings in this photo are and modeled the new (sadly not improved) Luna park by it. - look at the architecture of these buildings on both sides of the street. Instead of making Luna Park (today) grande they made it just okay. Very carnival-ish without the vavoom it once had. It's okay, "okay" doesn't cut it in my opinion. Do it right or don't do it at all. Understanding its a process - still Luna park has failed to capture the magic of Luna Park goneby.
